intro: Spergularia adenophora, commonly known as the sea sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant thrives in saline and sandy environments, often found in dunes and coastal grasslands. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Spergularia adenophora is also known for its ability to tolerate extreme environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh coastal habitats.
